title: Business Practical Skills Enhancement: Simulation-Based Learning Design Evaluation Methodology Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: At the end of a one-week short course, learners classify the ten provided learning design evaluation criteria into three priority groups (high/medium/low) based on achievement level (5-point scale) and receive a "met" rating in two or more of the three rubric criteria (clarity, consistency, validity).
Simulation tools can be used to predict and analyze the outcomes of educational strategies.
Team-based projects enable the design of evaluative methodologies applicable to real-world vocational training processes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
